  "description": "BeaconGate Limited is one of the leading business solution provider company in Nigeria, thus offering a wide range of human resource support services to many business organization.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality / HSE Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos

Job Summary


	The Quality / HSE Officer will oversee the quality assurance of aviation fuel (Jet A1) and implement health, safety, and environmental (HSE) practices within our terminal and tank farm operations.
	The role combines quality control, safety oversight, and operational monitoring to maintain fuel integrity and regulatory compliance


Key Responsibilities
Quality Assurance:


	Conduct routine quality checks on aviation fuel (density, temperature, water contamination, and sampling).
	Ensure compliance with JIG, API, EI, and DPR fuel quality standards.
	Monitor fuel storage, transfer, and handling to prevent contamination.
	Verify calibration and proper functioning of measurement and quality control equipment.


HSE &amp; Safety Management:


	Implement and enforce HSE policies and procedures across fuel handling and terminal operations.
	Conduct safety inductions, toolbox meetings, and operational safety inspections.
	Support incident reporting, root-cause analysis, and corrective actions.
	Lead emergency response drills and promote a strong safety culture.


Operational Oversight:


	Monitor receipt, storage, filtration, and dispatch processes to ensure quality standards are maintained.
	Inspect tanks, pumps, pipelines, hoses, filtration units, and loading systems for safety and compliance.
	Identify non-conformances and recommend corrective measures.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	HND/BSc in Industrial Chemistry, Petroleum Studies, Engineering, or related field.
	2&ndash;4 years of experience in quality control and HSE within aviation fuel, downstream oil &amp; gas, or terminal operations.
	In-depth knowledge of Jet A1 fuel quality standards and testing procedures.
	HSE Certifications (NEBOSH, OSHA, IATA, or equivalent) is preferred.
	Familiarity with DPR regulations and quality management systems.
	Excellent analytical, documentation, and reporting skills.
	Strong attention to detail and commitment to safety.


Salary
Negotiable.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and salary expectation to:&nbsp;beacongatejobportal@gmail.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&ldquo;Application &ndash; Quality / HSE Officer (Aviation)&rdquo;&nbsp;as the subject of the email.",

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Quality / HSE Officer
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos

Job Summary

	The role combines quality control, safety oversight, and operational monitoring to maintain fuel integrity and regulatory compliance


Key Responsibilities
Quality Assurance:


	Conduct routine quality checks on aviation fuel (density, temperature, water contamination, and sampling).
	Ensure compliance with JIG, API, EI, and DPR fuel quality standards.
	Monitor fuel storage, transfer, and handling to prevent contamination.
	Verify calibration and proper functioning of measurement and quality control equipment.


HSE & Safety Management:


	Implement and enforce HSE policies and procedures across fuel handling and terminal operations.
	Conduct safety inductions, toolbox meetings, and operational safety inspections.
	Support incident reporting, root-cause analysis, and corrective actions.
	Lead emergency response drills and promote a strong safety culture.


Operational Oversight:


	Monitor receipt, storage, filtration, and dispatch processes to ensure quality standards are maintained.
	Inspect tanks, pumps, pipelines, hoses, filtration units, and loading systems for safety and compliance.
	Identify non-conformances and recommend corrective measures.

	HND/BSc in Industrial Chemistry, Petroleum Studies, Engineering, or related field.
	2–4 years of experience in quality control and HSE within aviation fuel, downstream oil & gas, or terminal operations.
	In-depth knowledge of Jet A1 fuel quality standards and testing procedures.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Manager, VAS & Digital Services",
  "description": "9mobile is a Nigerian private limited liability company. EMTS acquired a Unified Access Service License from the Nigerian Communications Commission in 2007. The License enables EMTS provide Fixed Telephony (wired or wireless), Digital Mobile Services, International Gateway Services and National/Regional Long Distance Services in addition to spectrum assignments in the 900 and 1800 MHz bands.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Manager, VAS &amp; Digital Services

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Summary


	Drive the VAS portfolio strategy and ensure that approved services are rolled out and their lifecycles effectively managed through concerted supervision and project leadership of the VAS &amp; Digital Services team


Roles and Responsibilities
Tactical:


	Keep abreast of global and local best practice as it relates to the development of concepts for all EMTS&rsquo;s portal and VAS content.
	Ensure the continuous review of the unit&rsquo;s activities, make recommendations for improvement and implement approved initiatives to ensure enhanced performance of the team.
	Identify required resources, personnel and funding to achieve the unit&rsquo;s strategy.
	Establish and maintain relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.


Operational:


	Co-ordinate the development and deployment of the VAS &amp; Digital services roadmap and strategy while ensuring alignment with T2 mobile&rsquo;s overall business objectives and targets
	Develop initiatives and strategies to drive the uptake of VAS &amp; Digital Services on the network
	Drive engagement with the Digital &amp; Innovations team to prioritize partnership opportunities and integrate with multiple external partners
	Ensure that all launched VAS are in compliance with applicable regulatory directives
	Drive cross-functional working relationships with Engineering, Quality Assurance, and various Commercial teams to scope, plan and deliver new VAS/Digital initiatives
	Continuously review unit activities, make recommendations for improvement, and implement approved initiatives to ensure enhanced performance of the team
	Co-ordinate the development of unit processes, procedures &amp; policies, and ensure conformity by all unit members and other stakeholders
	&bull;eview the technical implementation plan for VAS &amp; Digital Services including identified potential barriers and recommended solutions
	Review and provide input in the development of propositions and business cases for up-to-date VAS/Digital Service innovations, and proffer recommendations to the Head, Products &amp; Digital Services.

The License enables EMTS provide Fixed Telephony (wired or wireless), Digital Mobile Services, International Gateway Services and National/Regional Long Distance Services in addition to spectrum assignments in the 900 and 1800 MHz bands.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Manager, VAS & Digital Services

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary

	Drive the VAS portfolio strategy and ensure that approved services are rolled out and their lifecycles effectively managed through concerted supervision and project leadership of the VAS & Digital Services team

Tactical:


	Keep abreast of global and local best practice as it relates to the development of concepts for all EMTS’s portal and VAS content.
	Ensure the continuous review of the unit’s activities, make recommendations for improvement and implement approved initiatives to ensure enhanced performance of the team.
	Identify required resources, personnel and funding to achieve the unit’s strategy.
	Establish and maintain relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.


Operational:


	Co-ordinate the development and deployment of the VAS & Digital services roadmap and strategy while ensuring alignment with T2 mobile’s overall business objectives and targets
	Develop initiatives and strategies to drive the uptake of VAS & Digital Services on the network
	Drive engagement with the Digital & Innovations team to prioritize partnership opportunities and integrate with multiple external partners
	Ensure that all launched VAS are in compliance with applicable regulatory directives
	Drive cross-functional working relationships with Engineering, Quality Assurance, and various Commercial teams to scope, plan and deliver new VAS/Digital initiatives
	Continuously review unit activities, make recommendations for improvement, and implement approved initiatives to ensure enhanced performance of the team
	Co-ordinate the development of unit processes, procedures & policies, and ensure conformity by all unit members and other stakeholders

	First Degree or equivalent in a relevant discipline.
	Six (6) to eight (8) years work experience, with at least three (3) years in a supervisory role.
	Postgraduate/ professional qualification in a related field will be an added advantage.
